results.title: Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7).
results.text_hl: METHODS: We compared the degree of improvement of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Nephropathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563161 @@@hypertensive nephropathy@@@ following 8 weeks' treatment with either the @GENE_AGTR1B @GENE_81638 @@@angiotensin II receptor type 1@@@ antagonist @CHEMICAL_Olmesartan_Medoxomil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068557 @@@olmesartan medoxomil@@@ or the cardioselective beta blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in 8-week-old spontaneously @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (SHRs).

citations.NLM: Igase M, Yokoyama H, Ferrario CM. Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7). Ther Adv Cardiovasc Dis. 2011 Dec;5(6):297-304. PMID: 22089474
